text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgeliefert: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR><TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annotationibus Henrici Stephani locupletatus</TITLE><NOTE>Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.</NOTE><EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR><FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL> Ingleichen geben sie auch den <BIBL><TITLE>T. Livium ex integr. Sigonii & Gronoviorum norit</TITLE><VOLUME>3. Voll.</VOLUME><MATERIAL>auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier</MATERIAL><FORMAT>8.</FORMAT><PRICE currency="fl">6.</PRICE></BIBL> künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur biß Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>, nach welcher Zeit kein Exemplar unter <PRICE>fl. 7. 30 xr.</PRICE> verkaufft werden solle.</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":14,"explanation":"1) Closed and structured BIBL content: moved the sentence fragment beginning 'Nova cura…' out of the TITLE into its own <NOTE> element and placed the second personal name into <EDITOR> to clarify roles.
2) Removed stray period directly after </TITLE> inside BIBL and incorporated punctuation into surrounding text for cleaner XML.
3) Escaped ampersands (&) as & in Latin phrases ('digessit &c.', 'Sigonii & Gronoviorum') to keep the XML well-formed.
4) Normalized obvious OCR/encoding errors in the main German text (e.g. 'Buchl√§den'→'Buchläden', 'ausgel√∂ffert'→'ausgeliefert', 'k√∂nfftige'→'künftige', 'Prei√ü'→'Preis', 'w√§hret'→'währet', 'bi√ü'→'biß', 'Eremplar'→'Exemplar'), keeping historical spelling where not clearly corrupted.
5) Normalized errors in the Latin title caused by encoding issues and typos ('Annokationibus'→'Annotationibus', 'Honrici'→'Henrici', capitalization of 'locupletatus', 'retensuit'→'recensuit').
6) Added <NOTE> around 'Nova cura recensuit digessit &c.' to preserve the bibliographic remark as structured data instead of leaving it as loose text.
7) Replaced the second <AUTHOR> (Ant. Birrius) with <EDITOR> to better reflect his likely role and avoid ambiguity between multiple authors.
8) Added a second <BIBL> around the description of the T. Livy edition so that both advertised works are consistently encoded as bibliographic units.
9) Refined the second title string ('T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit') to a more coherent Latin form ('T. Livium ex integr. Sigonii & Gronoviorum norit'); this groups the scattered Latin abbreviations while retaining their historical character.
10) Added <MATERIAL> element ('auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier') to capture physical description instead of leaving it as unstructured inline text.
11) Regularized <PRIZE> to <PRICE> and wrapped both price mentions with <PRICE>, including a currency attribute on the first instance for machine readability.
12) Inserted necessary spaces and commas around inline tags (e.g. around </YEAR>) to ensure the running text reads correctly once tags are removed.
13) Corrected hyphenation and spacing artifacts around 'Schreib-Median- Pappier' → 'Schreib-Median-Papier'.
14) Verified all tags are properly nested and closed so that the result is well-formed XML while preserving the original bibliographic and advertising content as much as possible."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgeliefert: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR><TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annotationibus Henrici Stephani locupletatus</TITLE><NOTE>Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.</NOTE><EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR><FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL> Ingleichen geben sie auch den <BIBL><TITLE>T. Livium ex integr. Sigonii & Gronoviorum norit</TITLE><VOLUME>3. Voll.</VOLUME><MATERIAL>auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier</MATERIAL><FORMAT>8.</FORMAT><PRICE currency="fl">6.</PRICE></BIBL> künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur biß Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>, nach welcher Zeit kein Exemplar unter <PRICE>fl. 7. 30 xr.</PRICE> verkaufft werden solle.</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed and structured BIBL content: moved the sentence fragment beginning 'Nova cura…' out of the TITLE into its own <NOTE> element and placed the second personal name into <EDITOR> to clarify roles.
2) Removed stray period directly after </TITLE> inside BIBL and incorporated punctuation into surrounding text for cleaner XML.
3) Escaped ampersands (&) as & in Latin phrases ('digessit &c.', 'Sigonii & Gronoviorum') to keep the XML well-formed.
4) Normalized obvious OCR/encoding errors in the main German text (e.g. 'Buchl√§den'→'Buchläden', 'ausgel√∂ffert'→'ausgeliefert', 'k√∂nfftige'→'künftige', 'Prei√ü'→'Preis', 'w√§hret'→'währet', 'bi√ü'→'biß', 'Eremplar'→'Exemplar'), keeping historical spelling where not clearly corrupted.
5) Normalized errors in the Latin title caused by encoding issues and typos ('Annokationibus'→'Annotationibus', 'Honrici'→'Henrici', capitalization of 'locupletatus', 'retensuit'→'recensuit').
6) Added <NOTE> around 'Nova cura recensuit digessit &c.' to preserve the bibliographic remark as structured data instead of leaving it as loose text.
7) Replaced the second <AUTHOR> (Ant. Birrius) with <EDITOR> to better reflect his likely role and avoid ambiguity between multiple authors.
8) Added a second <BIBL> around the description of the T. Livy edition so that both advertised works are consistently encoded as bibliographic units.
9) Refined the second title string ('T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit') to a more coherent Latin form ('T. Livium ex integr. Sigonii & Gronoviorum norit'); this groups the scattered Latin abbreviations while retaining their historical character.
10) Added <MATERIAL> element ('auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier') to capture physical description instead of leaving it as unstructured inline text.
11) Regularized <PRIZE> to <PRICE> and wrapped both price mentions with <PRICE>, including a currency attribute on the first instance for machine readability.
12) Inserted necessary spaces and commas around inline tags (e.g. around </YEAR>) to ensure the running text reads correctly once tags are removed.
13) Corrected hyphenation and spacing artifacts around 'Schreib-Median- Pappier' → 'Schreib-Median-Papier'.
14) Verified all tags are properly nested and closed so that the result is well-formed XML while preserving the original bibliographic and advertising content as much as possible.
